answers.answer: Hello,we cannot know if or how much damage has been done by you not taking care of yourself, though we do know that unmanaged diabetes does eventually lead to complications.  Some people can go for a long time with no complications, and others will get complications early.If you are feeling ok and no obvious symptoms, you may be lucky.Anyway, the past doesn't matter, only the here and now.  And it is here and now that you need to address your diabetes (to prevent future complications).You may also find you feel way better with blood sugar controlled and health much better.Bite the bullet and get back to doing what you know you should do.Best wishes

I hope the Md is only there to help you and not judge.  As sally said the past is the past.  getting control of your BG is what you need to do and hopefully the MD will help to guide you in controlling your diabetes.

Wow! Thanks for ur support! And ur rt perhaps drs r a lil too judgemental n that steers a lot of ppl away. Im going to look into a community class offered by the local hospital so that i can stay motivated n encouraged. N i feel fine other than constantly worrying tht an arterys gna bust n kill me cuz i know long term diabetes weakens such tgings

question: Ok so for the past year and a half I have been depressed and have not been very actuce, wise about diet, nor have I checked my sugar.  I was diagnosed type 2 in 2010.  I know that I was neglecting my health but now I am fearful to see my dr and get back on track.  I am wondering how much damage can I expect to see done durinv this period.
title: NEGLIGENT
